result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reynaldo Jeremiah Haye-Orengo

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Reynaldo Jeremiah Haye-Orengo in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Reynaldo Jeremiah Haye-Orengo.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Reynaldo Jeremiah Haye-Orengo in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Reynaldo Jeremiah Haye-Orengo in court.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for preliminary hearing. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court holds colloquy with the defendant. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact  order signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with XR (01/11/2021) and his mother BYR.  Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES THIS CASE WAS HEARD OFF THE RECORD.
Defendant Reynaldo Jeremiah Haye-Orengo in court with attorney Jane Jerman.  Defendant Reynaldo Jeremiah Haye-Orengo in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reynaldo Jeremiah Haye-Orengo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
